taxon_name.authority: Brotherus in H. G. A. Engler and K. Prantl

place_of_publication.publication_title: in H. G. A. Engler and K. Prantl, Nat. Pflanzenfam.

bio:treatment.description: Plants small to medium-sized. Stems pinnate. Stem and branch leaves with shape similar, size often noticeably differentiated; margins serrulate; ecostate or costa double, short; medial and distal laminal cells oblong-rhomboidal. Sexual condition phyllodioicous. Seta orangish red, fading to yellow with age. Capsule with operculum obliquely conic-rostrate.
bio:treatment.discussion: Recent molecular evidence suggests that Schwetschkeopsis might be more closely allied to members of Anomodontaceae than Myriniaceae (W. R. Buck and B. Goffinet 2000).
